attributes.action: Introduce the Highway Code as enforcable law
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Speed is not the killer on our roads - stupidity, carelessness, recklessness, impatience and discourteousness are.

If drivers were obliged by law to adhere to the sensible recommendations of the highway code there would be many less casualties.

E.G. parking where it does not constitute a hazard, obstruction or obscuration for other road users.

E.G. Indicating before and until FULLY completing ALL manouevres - motorway lane changers, taxi/bus drivers and, frighteningly, emergency services drivers, please take note!!
Failure to indicate an intention to manouevre, or indeed failing to cancel an indication, should be made a spot fine no points offence. People only learn when they are hit in the wallet!

E.G. cyclists not in a designated cycle lane who undertake stopped or slow moving traffic, or mount the pavement to "dodge" adverse traffic lights! You are casualties waiting to happen!
